meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Samoa.
meanings.sent1: In Samoa, you can buy many things with just one tala.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for tala at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The tala in my pocket jingled happily as I walked.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand tala.
meanings.sent5: The shiny tala sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The rhythmic pattern in Indian classical music.
meanings.sent1: The tala of the music was soothing and calming.
meanings.sent2: The dancers moved gracefully to the beat of the tala.
meanings.sent3: The tala seemed to dance on its own, guiding the musicians.
meanings.sent4: His heart followed the tala's rhythm, finding peace in the melody.
meanings.sent5: The tala echoed through the room, filling it with harmony.

meanings.definition: The uppermost bone in the ankle.
meanings.sent1: She felt a sharp pain in her tala after twisting her ankle.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the tala carefully to check for any fractures.
meanings.sent3: The tala bone is crucial for stability while walking or running.
meanings.sent4: He described the injury as a tiny crack in the tala.
meanings.sent5: The tala bone connected the foot to the leg, supporting every step.
